title: According to the book of Revelation, will Christians be raptured up to Heaven before the 7-year tribulation? - Quora

response.answer_text: The Rapture is a non-biblical term given to identify something that is described in the New Testament as “being caught up to meet the Lord in the air”. Amongst evangelicals, there is widespread agreement that such an event will occur. But there is a real hornet’s nest over exactly when it happens.  I have often said that the Rapture debate is the most one-sided argument of all the major doctrinal disagreements that separate Christians. Yet the vast majority of professed Christians in the world today (at least those who have any interest in end time issues) stubbornly stick to the side that has virtually no evidence to support their position. Can you guess why? Think about it. Both sides say there is going to be a number of years of the worst suffering the world has ever experienced. But one side says you are going to have to go through it (if it doesn’t kill you first). The other side says you don’t need to worry about it at all, because it’s never going to happen… that is, not to YOU. You will be “raptured” (i.e. taken to heaven) before it all happens. So which position do you think will be incredibly popular, with or without any proof text? The Bible is clear about the fact that Christians are going to have to go through this period of great suffering (called The Great Tribulation), and, indeed, that suffering of one sort or another is to be part of our lot in every age. Suffering is what the phrase “taking up your cross” represents. Suck it up, and stop running away from it. God put all that stuff about persecution, etc. in the Bible for a reason. If you are one of the few who is prepared to hear the truth, even if it is uncomfortable, then please watch this short (10-minute) video, which I released about a month ago: Everything You Need to Know About the Rapture

No. According to the Book of Revelation, the Great Tribulation will last 3 & 1/2 years and the event Christians widely misinterpret as a rapture to Heaven with God before the Great Tribulation is in all actuality an event at the very end of the 3 & 1/2 years that describes Jesus’ return. So no, Christians won’t be whisking off to Heaven to escape the Hour of Temptation. Most Christians are actually caught in a very powerful spell cast by Satan and his Agents here on earth that has deceived the world already and caused the inhabitants of the earth to participate in the great falling away from God. The result of this is we live in a world where every nations says they know the God of the Bible but no nation keeps his commandments. This is why God will allow the Great Tribulation to come to pass; to separate those that know him from those that don’t. There is the Wilderness though, for those who do know God. It will be the only place of safety available for man on Earth during that time and people will have about a month to get there from the time the Abomination of Desolation out of the Catholic Church sets foot in the 3rd Temple and claims to be God at the command of Satan, as Satan commanded Nimrod in the original Babylon. Revelation 12 King James Version 12 And there appeared a great wonder in heaven; a woman clothed with the sun, and the moon under her feet, and upon her head a crown of twelve stars: 2 And she being with child cried, travailing in birth, and pained to be delivered. 3 And there appeared another wonder in heaven; and behold a great red dragon, having seven heads and ten horns, and seven crowns upon his heads. 4 And his tail drew the third part of the stars of heaven, and did cast them to the earth: and the dragon stood before the woman which was ready to be delivered, for to devour her child as soon as it was born. 5 And she brought forth a man child, who was to rule all nations with a rod of iron: and her child was caught up unto God, and to his throne. 6 And the woman fled into the wilderness, where she hath a place prepared of God, that they should feed her there a thousand two hundred and threescore days. 7 And there was war in heaven: Michael and his angels fought against the dragon; and the dragon fought and his angels, 8 And prevailed not; neither was their place found any more in heaven. 9 And the great dragon was cast out, that old serpent, called the Devil, and Satan, which deceiveth the whole world: he was cast out into the earth, and his angels were cast out with him. 10 And I heard a loud voice saying in heaven, Now is come salvation, and strength, and the kingdom of our God, and the power of his Christ: for the accuser of our brethren is cast down, which accused them before our God day and night. 11 And they overcame him by the blood of the Lamb, and by the word of their testimony; and they loved not their lives unto the death. 12 Therefore rejoice, ye heavens, and ye that dwell in them. Woe to the inhabiters of the earth and of the sea! for the devil is come down unto you, having great wrath, because he knoweth that he hath but a short time. 13 And when the dragon saw that he was cast unto the earth, he persecuted the woman which brought forth the man child. 14 And to the woman were given two wings of a great eagle, that she might fly into the wilderness, into her place, where she is nourished for a time, and times, and half a time, from the face of the serpent. 15 And the serpent cast out of his mouth water as a flood after the woman, that he might cause her to be carried away of the flood. 16 And the earth helped the woman, and the earth opened her mouth, and swallowed up the flood which the dragon cast out of his mouth. 17 And the dragon was wroth with the woman, and went to make war with the remnant of her seed, which keep the commandments of God, and have the testimony of Jesus Christ. Out of this woman, this people, a Savior was promised to come, and Israel struggled to bring about this Salvation, and wrestled with sin and her enemies, which is the Dragon. Each head represents a world power that has come out of Babylon, Medo-Persia, Greece and Rome, with each horn being a king that came out of these nations, the last of them being the “Little Horn” of Daniel, which is the Antichrist and the Abomination of Desolation, who will come out of Rome, which is the European Union today, specifically the Vatican. He came from the Father and lived righteously, he died for the sins of his people and was resurrected and returned back to Heaven where he is waiting for his people to acknowledge their offense as it is written in the Book of Hosea. During this time period, Satan has devoured and tempted and persecuted the people of Israel. He was cast down out of Heaven with his angels before mankind was ever created, and in rage has sought to slay and deceive mankind ever since with his Mystery Religion. I hope this has been of help. Take care.

I believe so. Here’s why: The key to understanding the timeline of Revelation is verse 4:1, which begins with “after these things…” (or afternoon this, depending on the version). This phrase in the original Greek is “meta tauta.” So after what things? The things being referenced prior to chapter 4 are the Church. In fact, the Church isn’t mentioned again in the rest of the book. Why is this? I believe it is because the Church has been taken up. In fact, in verse 1 of chapter 4 of Revelation, the angel speaking tells John: “Come up here, and I will show you things which must take place after this.” What is being said here? “Come up here” certainly sounds like the Rapture event, doesn’t it? This signifies the end of the Church Age as the Church is not mentioned again. Then the Angel says, “after this.” After what? The rapture event itself. What things are being shown? From this point on, they are tribulation events. One more piece of evidence for a pre-tribulation rapture: “So you also, when you see all these things, know that it is near—at the doors!” Matthew‬ 24:33‬ NKJV‬‬ Jesus is telling us what to look for before He takes His Church. If the rapture was in the middle of the tribulation, we’d know exactly when His return would be, because the Tribulation begins when the 7-year peace treaty is signed. Thus we would know the exact mid-point of the tribulation.

The Rapture is actually best seen, not in the Book of Revelation, as clearly as in 2 Thessalonians 4:16–17: “ 16 For the Lord himself will come down from heaven, with a loud command, with the voice of the archangel and with the trumpet call of God, and the dead in Christ will rise first. 17 After that, we who are still alive and are left will be caught up together with them in the clouds to meet the Lord in the air. And so we will be with the Lord forever. 18 Therefore encourage one another with these words.” That phrase “caught up” is also referred” as “rapture”, which is an old English word meaning to get “carried away” or “caught up”. That word in Greek is |aJrpavzw“ or “harpazo” (pronounced har-pad'-zo), which means “to seize, catch (away, up), pluck, pull, take (by force)”.

The Rapture is not described in the Book of Revelation. The Rapture is described in 1 Thessalonians, chapter 4, verse 17: “Then we which are alive and remain shall be caught up together with them in the clouds, to meet the Lord in the air: and so shall we ever be with the Lord.” Some people believe it will happen before the Tribulation, some believe it will happen after the Tribulation. Either way, it WILL happen.
